result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Justice Point Discharge Report, filed. Forwarded to Judge for review.

*Defendant is in bench warrant status. Court takes no further action at this time.

Defendant Maurice D Jackson not in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Maurice D Jackson.  Attorney Jacob Corr for Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant failing to appear. Court previously issued warrant. No further action taken.

Defendant Maurice D Jackson appeared by video.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Maurice D Jackson.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court inquiries as to why defendant is on zoom. Defense advises court. For reasons stated on the record, defendant failing to follow court orders, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Maurice D Jackson not in court.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris appeared by video for Maurice D Jackson.  Attorney Jennifer Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant fails to appear on time for hearing. Defendant appears after case is called before warrant issued. Court admonishes defendant again on tardiness. Court further orders all future court dates in person for defendant. Defense in need of global offer. State to provide. Defense request additional status date. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

Defendant Maurice D Jackson in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Michael Christopher Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Maurice D Jackson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Case in court for scheduling conference. Court admonishes defendant for tardiness. Discovery and offer is needed. State to provide. Defense requests more time for review. Case remains calendared in Branch 4  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
Received and Filed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Maurice Devon Jackson in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  ALL PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer S. Colwell. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.

-signed and filed. 
Attorney Thomas Harris
Court held colloquy with Defendant. Defendant agreed to WAIVE TIME LIMITS for Preliminary hearing.

JUDGE FEISS, BRANCH 46 FOR JUDGE HANRAHAN, BRANCH 4.
Defendant Maurice Devon Jackson in Court with Attorney Thomas Holland Reed on behalf of the Public Defender's Office. Owen M Piotrowski on behalf of Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Order to Show Cause hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel for Defendant. Statements by Attorney Reed. Court found Defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. Court appointed Attorney Thomas Harris, present via Zoom, to represent  Defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. DEFENDANT DOES NOT REIMBURSE THE COUNTY; however, Court ordered Defendant to pay a one-time fee of $60.00 at the completion of the case. Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 4. 
Preliminary hearing scheduled June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am before Commissioner Phillips.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: EAB.
Branch 4 is down on 5-13-2022. Case being spun to Branch 46. Parties advised of change. Parties notified.

Order to Show Cause hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Judge Feiss will handle the hearing for Judge Hanrahan.
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Information provided to JusticePoint Pretrial Case Manager and Public Defender's Office.

Defendant Maurice Devon Jackson in court appear by video.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for status. SPD has not appointed counsel.
Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-LEE hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed. Justice Point Supervision Report. Deputy Court Clerk: LVD
Case charged by ADA Chad Wozniak. Per Chief Judge Directive 21-13, this case is transferred to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4.

Defendant Maurice Devon Jackson in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for a status of coounsel. Defendant is eligible for public defender representation. SPD need more time to appoint on this case.  Court ordered case adjourned for a Status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

IF THE DEFENDANT FAILS TO REPORT A WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Maurice Devon Jackson in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46.
